item.title: Cultural, mechanical and chemical weed control in wheat
item.description: Effective weed control in wheat crop promises attractive grains harvest and subsequent food security in Pakistan. The objective of this study was to evaluate cultural (stale seed bed and double seed rate), mechanical (bar harrow, hand hoeing and hand pulling) and chemical weed control (bromoxynil+MCPA, fenoxaprop-p-ethyl, and a combination of both] for managing weeds and improving yield in wheat crop. Weed control methods varied in suppressing weeds and improving grain yield of wheat.
